name: postgres
description: Get, add and update data in Postgres

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete an entire table or rows in a table

options.name: Execute Query
options.description: Execute an SQL query

options.name: Insert
options.description: Insert rows in a table

options.name: Insert or Update
options.description: Insert or update rows in a table
options.action: Insert or update rows in a table

options.name: Select
options.description: Select rows from a table

options.name: Update
options.description: Update rows in a table

properties.name: schema
properties.description: The schema that contains the table you want to work on

properties.name: table
properties.description: The table you want to work on

options.name: Truncate
options.description: Only removes the table's data and preserves the table's structure

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete the rows that match the 'Select Rows' conditions below. If no selection is made, all rows in the table are deleted.

options.name: Drop
options.description: Deletes the table's data and also the table's structure permanently

properties.name: restartSequences
properties.description: Whether to reset identity (auto-increment) columns to their initial values

properties.name: where
properties.description: If not set, all rows will be selected

values.name: column
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

values.name: condition
values.description: The operator to check the column against. When using 'LIKE' operator percent sign ( %) matches zero or more characters, underscore ( _ ) matches any single character.

properties.name: combineConditions
properties.description: How to combine the conditions defined in "Select Rows": AND requires all conditions to be true, OR requires at least one condition to be true

options.name: AND
options.description: Only rows that meet all the conditions are selected

options.name: OR
options.description: Rows that meet at least one condition are selected

options.name: cascade
options.description: Whether to drop all objects that depend on the table, such as views and sequences

options.name: connectionTimeout
options.description: Number of seconds reserved for connecting to the database

options.name: delayClosingIdleConnection
options.description: Number of seconds to wait before idle connection would be eligible for closing

options.name: queryBatching
Single Query
options.description: A single query for all incoming items

options.name: Independent
options.description: Execute one query per incoming item of the run

options.name: Transaction
options.description: Execute all queries in a transaction, if a failure occurs, all changes are rolled back
The way queries should be sent to the database

options.name: queryReplacement
options.description: Comma-separated list of the values you want to use as query parameters. More info.
options.hint: Comma-separated list of values: reference them in your query as $1, $2, $3…

options.displayName: Treat query parameters in single quotes as text
options.name: treatQueryParametersInSingleQuotesAsText
options.description: Whether to treat query parameters enclosed in single quotes as text e.g. '$1'

options.name: outputColumns
options.description: Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression

options.name: largeNumbersOutput
Text
options.description: Use this if you expect numbers longer than 16 digits (otherwise numbers may be incorrect)

options.hint: Applies to NUMERIC and BIGINT columns only

options.name: skipOnConflict
options.description: Whether to skip the row and do not throw error if a unique constraint or exclusion constraint is violated

options.name: replaceEmptyStrings
options.description: Whether to replace empty strings with NULL in input, could be useful when data come from spreadsheet

properties.name: query
properties.description: The SQL query to execute. You can use n8n expressions and $1, $2, $3, etc to refer to the 'Query Parameters' set in options below.
properties.placeholder: e.g. SELECT id, name FROM product WHERE quantity > $1 AND price <= $2
properties.hint: Consider using query parameters to prevent SQL injection attacks. Add them in the options below

options.name: cascade
options.description: Whether to drop all objects that depend on the table, such as views and sequences

options.name: connectionTimeout
options.description: Number of seconds reserved for connecting to the database

options.name: delayClosingIdleConnection
options.description: Number of seconds to wait before idle connection would be eligible for closing

options.name: queryBatching
Single Query
options.description: A single query for all incoming items

options.name: Independent
options.description: Execute one query per incoming item of the run

options.name: Transaction
options.description: Execute all queries in a transaction, if a failure occurs, all changes are rolled back
The way queries should be sent to the database

options.name: queryReplacement
options.description: Comma-separated list of the values you want to use as query parameters. More info.
options.hint: Comma-separated list of values: reference them in your query as $1, $2, $3…

options.displayName: Treat query parameters in single quotes as text
options.name: treatQueryParametersInSingleQuotesAsText
options.description: Whether to treat query parameters enclosed in single quotes as text e.g. '$1'

options.name: outputColumns
options.description: Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression

options.name: largeNumbersOutput
Text
options.description: Use this if you expect numbers longer than 16 digits (otherwise numbers may be incorrect)

options.hint: Applies to NUMERIC and BIGINT columns only

options.name: skipOnConflict
options.description: Whether to skip the row and do not throw error if a unique constraint or exclusion constraint is violated

options.name: replaceEmptyStrings
options.description: Whether to replace empty strings with NULL in input, could be useful when data come from spreadsheet

properties.name: dataMode
properties.description: Whether to map node input properties and the table data automatically or manually

options.name: Auto-Map Input Data to Columns
options.description: Use when node input properties names exactly match the table column names

options.name: Map Each Column Manually
options.description: Set the value for each destination column manually

properties.name: notice
properties.displayName: In this mode, make sure incoming data fields are named the same as the columns in your table. If needed, use an 'Edit Fields' node before this node to change the field names.

values.name: column
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

options.name: cascade
options.description: Whether to drop all objects that depend on the table, such as views and sequences

options.name: connectionTimeout
options.description: Number of seconds reserved for connecting to the database

options.name: delayClosingIdleConnection
options.description: Number of seconds to wait before idle connection would be eligible for closing

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.description: If not set, all rows will be selected

values.description: The operator to check the column against. When using 'LIKE' operator percent sign ( %) matches zero or more characters, underscore ( _ ) matches any single character.

properties.name: dataMode

options.name: Auto-Map Input Data to Columns
options.description: Use when node input properties names exactly match the table column names

options.name: Map Each Column Manually
options.description: Set the value for each destination column manually

properties.name: notice
properties.displayName: In this mode, make sure incoming data fields are named the same as the columns in your table. If needed, use an 'Edit Fields' node before this node to change the field names.

properties.name: columnToMatchOn
properties.description: The column to compare when finding the rows to update. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.
properties.hint: The column to use when matching rows in Postgres to the input items of this node. Usually an ID.

properties.name: valueToMatchOn
properties.displayName: Value of Column to Match On
properties.description: Rows with a value in the specified "Column to Match On" that corresponds to the value in this field will be updated

values.name: column
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

properties.name: dataMode
properties.description: Whether to map node input properties and the table data automatically or manually

options.name: Auto-Map Input Data to Columns
options.description: Use when node input properties names exactly match the table column names

options.name: Map Each Column Manually
options.description: Set the value for each destination column manually

properties.name: notice
properties.displayName: In this mode, make sure incoming data fields are named the same as the columns in your table. If needed, use an 'Edit Fields' node before this node to change the field names.

properties.name: columnToMatchOn
properties.description: The column to compare when finding the rows to update. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.
properties.hint: Used to find the correct row(s) to update. Doesn't get changed. Has to be unique.

properties.name: valueToMatchOn
properties.description: Rows with a value in the specified "Column to Match On" that corresponds to the value in this field will be updated. New rows will be created for non-matching items.

values.name: column
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

options.description: Whether to drop all objects that depend on the table, such as views and sequences

options.description: Number of seconds reserved for connecting to the database

options.description: Number of seconds to wait before idle connection would be eligible for closing
